title: Afternoon near Arkville, New York
provenance_text:
Alexander Helwig Wyant [1836-1892]; purchased from the artist by John P. McWilliams, 1892 [1]; S. S. Dustin, New York, NY by 1910? until January 1911 [1,2]; M. Knoedler & Co., New York, NY, January 1911 [3]; purchased by Department of Fine Arts, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, November 1911 [4].

Notes:
[1]. See letter from M. Knoedler & Co. dated April 29, 1987 in curatorial file. 
[2]. Likely Silas S. Dustin [1855-1940], an artist and, around this time, a freelance art dealer (see curatorial file).
[3]. Knoedler NY stock no. 12263 with a cost of $7500 (The Getty Research Institute).
[4]. Sale to Carnegie Institute recorded in Knoedler NY sales books in December 1911.

creator.birth_place: Evans Creek (Tuscarawas county, Ohio, United States)
creator.death_place: New York City (New York state, United States)
